member.name: M:QCI.DataAccess.SqlHelper.AttachParameters(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[])
member.summary:
This method is used to attach array of SqlParameters to a SqlCommand.
A value of DBNull will be assigned to any parameter with a direction of InputOutput and a value of null.
This behavior will prevent default values from being used, but this will be the less common case than an intended pure output parameter (derived as InputOutput) where the user provided no input value.
member.param: Command to which the parameters will be added.
Array of SqlParameters used to execute the command.

member.name: T:QCI.Diagnostics.EventLogHelper
member.summary: Provides utility methods to interact with Windows Event Logs. Works around a limitation with System.Diagnostics.EventLog class that causes exceptions when checking and creating event sources due to the new security restrictions added to Vista/Win2008.
member.remarks: References: - EventLog Key: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa363648(VS.85).aspx - Event Sources: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa363661(VS.85).aspx

member.name: M:QCI.Diagnostics.EventLogHelper.SourceExists(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether an event source is registered on the local computer. The Application event log is checked first for the source and must be accessable or an exception is thrown. No exception is thrown if a any other log cannot be accessed due to permissions (the Security log in particular).
member.param: The name of the event source.
member.returns: true if the event source is registered on the local computer; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:QCI.Diagnostics.EventLogHelper.SourceExists(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether an event source is registered on the local computer The specified event log is checked first for the source and must be accessable or an exception is thrown. No exception is thrown if a any other log cannot be accessed due to permissions (the Security log in particular).
member.param: The name of the log file to use.
The name of the event source.
member.returns: true if the event source is registered on the local computer; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:QCI.Diagnostics.EventLogHelper.CreateEventSource(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a valid event source for writing entries to the Application log on the local computer. This method cannot create new custom logs on the local computer; use if this is needed.
member.param: The source name to be registered on the local computer.
member.remarks: The source cannot already exists on the local computer. The source name cannot match an existing event log name. The full registry key path to the source name cannot be longer than 254 characters.

member.name: M:QCI.Diagnostics.EventLogHelper.CreateEventSource(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a valid event source for writing entries to an existing log on the local computer. This method cannot create new custom logs on the local computer; use if this is needed.
member.param: The source name to be registered on the local computer.
The name of the log the source's entries will be written to. Possible values include: Application, System, or a custom event log already created.
member.remarks: The source cannot already exists on the local computer. The source name cannot match an existing event log name. The full registry key path to the source name cannot be longer than 254 characters.

member.name: T:QCI.Encryption.CryptoService
member.summary: Provides utility methods to more easily use the symmetric cryptographic algorithms.

member.name: M:QCI.Encryption.CryptoService.Encrypt(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Encrypts a string using Triple-DES and a password. This method should not be used for high volume encryption. If many cryptographic operations are required, use an instance of the instead.
member.param: String balue to be encrypted.
Password to be used for Key and IV. Must be at least 8 characters in length.
member.returns: Returns encrypted Base64 String

member.name: M:QCI.Encryption.CryptoService.Decrypt(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Decrypts a string previously encrypted with a password using . This method should not be used for high volume encryption. If many cryptographic operations are required, use an instance of the instead.
member.param: The encrypted string to decrypt.
Password to be used for Key and IV. Must be at least 8 characters in length.
member.returns: The result from base-64 decoding, then decrypting the passed string value.

member.name: M:QCI.Encryption.CryptoService.GenerateSalt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a byte array filled with a cryptographically strong sequence of random values for use as salt for other cryptographic operations. A minimum length of 16 bytes is recommended for salt values.
member.param: Length of the byte array to be returned.
member.returns: Byte array filled with random values.

member.name: M:QCI.Encryption.CryptoService.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of to use Triple-DES with a secure password.
member.param: Secret password to use to generate the Key and IV.

member.name: M:QCI.Encryption.CryptoService.#ctor(QCI.Encryption.EncryptionAlgorithm,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of to use the specified encryption with a secure password.
member.param: Cryptographic algorithm to use.
Secret password to use to generate the Key and IV.

member.name: M:QCI.Encryption.CryptoService.#ctor(QCI.Encryption.EncryptionAlgorithm,System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class with the specified encryption algorithm, secret key, and initialization vector (IV).
member.param: Cryptographic algorithm to use.

member.name: T:QCI.Globalization.SimpleTimeZone
member.summary: A concrete subclass of System.TimeZone that represents a time zone for use with a Gregorian calendar. This class does not handle historical changes and has a limited daylight-savings time rules engine.
member.remarks:
Daylight-saving time (DST) can be supported by providing a rules string during instantiation. The DST rules string must have the following format:
[delta],[start],[end]
Field Description
[delta]
Number or hours and minutes to shift the clock during daylight-saving time. This value must be formatted as: [-]hh[:mm] where hour (hh) is required and can be a single digit and minutes (mm) are optional.
[start]/[end]
Indicates when the change to and from summer time occurs. The variable [start] describes the date of the change to summer time, and [end] describes the date of the change back to standard time.
Both have the format: M[m].[n].[d]/[hh:mm]
Where [m] is the numeric month (1 12) the change occurs, [d] is the day-of-week (0 = Sun, 6 = Sat) of the change, [n] is the number of the occurrence of the day-of-week [1 5] within the month, and [hh:mm] is the hour and minute of the change. Set [n] to 5 to indicate the last occurrence of [d] in month [m]. The time [hh:mm] must be specified in 24-hour time with leading zeros as needed (e.g., 01:00 = 1:00a, 13:00 = 1:00p).
Examples:
Time Zone DST Rules String
US Central Time "1:00,M4.1.0/02:00,M10.5.0/02:00"
Israel Time "1:00,M4.3.0/2:00,M8.4.6/2:00"
New Zealand Time "1:00,M10.5.0/2:00,M3.1.0/3:00"

member.name: T:QCI.Timers.ClockSynchronizedTimer
member.summary: A specialized timer, modeled after , designed to generate recurring events aligned with the system clock such that events are raised on the same second of each minute. For example, if the timer is setup to generate events every 20 seconds, events will be raised at the 00th, 20th, and 40th second of every minute. A small (100 ms) delay is included in the scheduling so events do not get raised just shy of the correct second.

member.name: M:QCI.Timers.ClockSynchronizedTimer.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class, and sets all properties to their default initial values.

member.name: M:QCI.Timers.ClockSynchronizedTimer.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class, and sets the property to the specified time period.
member.param: The time, in milliseconds, between events.
member.exception: The value of the interval parameter is less than zero.

member.name: M:QCI.Timers.ClockSynchronizedTimer.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class, and sets the and properties.
member.param: The time, in milliseconds, between events.
The amount of time, in milliseconds, to shift the raising of events.
member.exception: The value of the interval parameter is less than zero.

member.name: E:QCI.Timers.ClockSynchronizedTimer.Elapsed
member.summary: Occurs when the timed interval elapses. The timer is stopped before this event and restarted afterward to prevent overlapping event periods.

member.name: P:QCI.Timers.ClockSynchronizedTimer.Interval
member.summary: Gets or sets the interval (in milliseconds) at which to raise the event. The interval must evenly divide a minute so all events can start at 00 seconds each minute.
member.returns: The time, in milliseconds, between raisings of the event. The default is 60 seconds.
member.exception: The interval is less than or equal to zero, or it does not evenly divide one minute.

member.name: P:QCI.Timers.ClockSynchronizedTimer.IntervalInSeconds
member.summary: Gets or sets the interval (in seconds) at which to raise the event. The interval must evenly divide a minute so all events can start at 00 seconds each minute.
member.returns: The time, in seconds, between raisings of the event. The default is 60 seconds.
member.exception: The interval is less than or equal to zero, or it does not evenly divide one minute.

member.name: P:QCI.Timers.ClockSynchronizedTimer.Offset
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of offset (in milliseconds) used to adjust the times at which the event is raised.

member.name: P:QCI.Timers.ClockSynchronizedTimer.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this timer should raise the event.
member.returns: true if the should raise the event; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: P:QCI.Timers.ClockSynchronizedTimer.AutoReset
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this timer should raise the event each time the specified interval elapses, or only after the first time it elapses.
member.returns: true if this timer should raise the event each time the interval elapses; false if it should raise the event only once, after the first time the interval elapses. The default is true.

member.name: P:QCI.Timers.ClockSynchronizedTimer.SynchronizingObject
member.summary: Gets or sets the object used to marshal event-handler calls that are issued when an interval has elapsed.
member.returns: The representing the object used to marshal the event-handler calls that are issued when an interval has elapsed. The default is null.

Strong passwords meet the following requirements: At least six characters in length, does not contain three or more characters from the user's full name or account name, and contains characters from at least three of the following five categories: (1) uppercase characters (A-Z), (2) lowercase characters (a-z), (3) base-10 digits (0-9), (4) non-alphanumeric (for example: !, $, #, or %), (5) certain Unicode characters).

member.name: P:QCI.Web.Security.CustomMembershipProviderBase.AccountLockoutDurationInMinutes
member.summary: Gets the number of minutes a locked-out account remains locked before automatically becoming unlocked. The available range is from 0 minutes through 99,999 minutes. If you set the account lockout duration to 0, the account will be locked out until an administrator explicitly unlocks it.

member.name: T:QCI.Web.DataGridHelper
member.summary: Provides a set of utility methods to help data bind DataGrid controls.

remarks.para: The DataGridHelper class provides a set of utility methods designed easily add the following behaviors to a standard WebForm DataGrid control.

list.item: Display a 'no records' message when the grid is bound to an empty data source.
Keep the page index in bounds (to prevent out-of-range exceptions).
Show the Pager row only when there is more than one page.

remarks.para: Note that the Footer row is used to display the no-records message.

Limitations: The design of this application block requires that the record count be known before the grid is bound. This limitation prevents a SqlDataReader from being used as a data source - or any other object that does not implement ICollection.

member.name: M:QCI.Web.DataGridHelper.BindGrid(System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid,System.Data.DataSet,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Binds a DataGrid using data from a DataSet while forcing the page index in bounds (to avoid out-of-range exceptions). The Footer row will be used for the 'no records' message when the DataGrid is empty. The Pager row is made visible when there is more than one page of items.
member.param: The DataGrid to be bound.
The DataSet containing values for the grid. Only the first table is used.
The DataKeyField property for the DataGrid.
The message text to display in the footer when the DataGrid contains no items. Use 'null' to specify no message.

member.name: T:QCI.Web.SecureUrl
member.summary: Generates tamper-proof URLs secured with an MD5 digest added to the query string. URLs generated with this class are user-specific; a url generated for one user cannot be used by another. MD5 digests are NOT added to URLs with no query string parameters. It is assumed page-level authorization is handled by the application.
member.remarks: A better name for this class would have been something like 'SecureQueryString', since this class only protects against tampering when there is at least one value in the query string.

member.name: M:QCI.Web.SecureUrl.VerifyDigestOfRequest(System.Web.HttpRequest)
member.summary: Verifies the URL of a request has not beed tampered with by checking any security digest present in the query string. If a security digest is required for the request, it must be present. If a digest is present, it must be valid. An is thrown when a digest is required but not present, or when a digest is present but not valid.
member.param: HttpRequest to verify.
member.exception: Digest parameter is required but not present in the URL, or digest is present but not valid.

member.name: M:QCI.Web.SecureUrl.VerifyDigestOfRequest(System.Web.HttpRequest,System.String)
member.summary: Verifies the URL of a request has not beed tampered with by checking any security digest present in the query string. If a security digest is required for the request, it must be present. If a digest is present, it must be valid. An is thrown when a digest is required but not present, or when a digest is present but not valid.
member.param: HttpRequest to verify.
Username of the user to assume will be accessing the URL.
member.exception: Digest parameter is required but not present in the URL, or digest parameter is present in the URL but not valid.

member.name: M:QCI.Web.SecureUrl.IsRequestUrlValid(System.Web.HttpRequest)
member.summary: Determines if the URL of a request has beed tampered with by checking the security digest present in the query string. If a security digest is required for the request, it must be present. If a digest is present, it must be valid.
member.returns: Returns false if a digest is required but not present, or if present but not valid; otherwise, returns true.

member.name: M:QCI.Web.SecureUrl.IsRequestUrlValid(System.Web.HttpRequest,System.String)
member.summary: Determines if the URL of a request has beed tampered with by checking the security digest present in the query string. If a security digest is required for the request, it must be present; If a digest is present, it must be valid.
member.param: HttpRequest to be checked.
Username of the user to assume will be accessing the URL.
member.returns: Returns false if a digest is required but not present, or if present but not valid; otherwise, returns true.

member.name: T:QCI.Web.Validation.FieldValidation
member.summary: Utility class to help reduce the amount of validation logic required to verify user-entered data in a TextBox or DropDownList web control.

remarks.para: The FieldValidation class is designed to greatly reduce the volume of code required to perform standard validations on user-entered data in TextBox and DropDownList controls.

Specifically, this class helps check for the following conditions:
Required fields missing values.
Text values that are either too long or too short.
Numeric values that are too large and/or too small.
Invalid selections in DropDownList boxes.
In most cases, only one line of code is needed to perform all the applicable checks above.

Limitations: Regular expressions are used to verify the string values can be parsed to the data type requested. Because of this, float strings using scientific notation will be considered invalid when calling ValidateFloatField overloads.

member.name: T:System.Linq.Dynamic.DynamicQueryable
member.summary:
Implements extension methods for dynamically querying objects that implement the IQueryable<T> interface.
These methods correspond to their System.Linq.Queryable counterparts, except that they operate on IQueryable instead of IQueryable<T> and use strings instead of lambda expressions to express predicates, selectors, and orderings. IQueryable is the non-generic base interface for IQueryable<T>, so the methods can be used even when T isnt known on beforehand (i.e., when the source of a query is dynamically determined).
Note that because a dynamic predicate or ordering expression does not affect the result type, generic overloads are provided for Where and OrderBy in order to preserve strong typing when possible.

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.DynamicQueryable.Where``1(System.Linq.IQueryable{``0},System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: QCI Extension: Filters elements defined by this query based on a predicate.
member.typeparam: The type of the elements of .
member.param: An defining the elements to be ordered.

Predicate expression written in the expression language implemented by the Dynamic Expression API. Members of the current instance are automatically in scope and the instance itself can be referenced using the keyword 'it'.
Substitution values for placeholders referenced in the predicate expression string.
member.returns: A new query that wraps the original query and adds additional filtering.
member.remarks:
Identifiers of the form @X, where X is an integral number greater than or equal to zero, are used to denote the substitution values within an expression string.
For example:
customers.Where("Country = @0", country);
Casing is not significant for identifiers and keywords.
member.exception: or is null.

member.summary: QCI Extension: Filters elements defined by this query based on a predicate.

member.returns: A new query that wraps the original query and adds a filtering operation.
member.remarks:
Identifiers of the form @X, where X is an integral number greater than or equal to zero, are used to denote the substitution values within an expression string.
For example:

Casing is not significant for identifiers and keywords.

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.DynamicQueryable.OrderBy``1(System.Linq.IQueryable{``0},System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: QCI Extension: Sorts the elements defined by this query in ascending order using a specified ordering expression.
member.typeparam: The type of the elements of .
member.param: Query defining the elements to be ordered.

Element ordering expression written in the expression language implemented by the Dynamic Expression API. Members of the current instance are automatically in scope and the instance itself can be referenced using the keyword 'it'.
Substitution values for placeholders referenced in the ordering expression string.
member.returns: A new query that wraps the original query and adds an element sorting operation.
member.remarks:
The OrderBy method permits a sequence of orderings to be specified, separated by commas. Each ordering may optionally be followed by asc or ascending to indicate ascending order, or desc or descending to indicate descending order. The default order is ascending.
The example
products.OrderBy("Category.CategoryName, UnitPrice descending");
orders a sequence of products by ascending category name and, within each category, descending unit price.
member.exception: or is null.

member.summary: Defines utility methods for dynamically parsing and creating lambda expressions.

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.DynamicExpression.Parse(System.Type,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Parses the given expression and returns an expression tree. If the resultType parameter is non-null it specifies the required result type of the expression. The values parameter supplies zero or more substitution values that may be referenced in the expression.
member.param: String expression to be parsed, written in the expression language implemented by the Dynamic Expression API.
Substitution values for placeholders referenced in the expression string.
member.returns: An expression tree representing the specified expression string.
member.remarks:
Identifiers of the forms @X, where X is an integral number greater than or equal to zero, are used to denote the substitution values within an expression string.
For example:
customers.Where("Country = @0", country);
Casing is not significant for identifiers and keywords.

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.DynamicExpression.CreateClass(System.Linq.Dynamic.DynamicProperty[])
member.summary: Dynamically creates a new data class containing a given set of public properties and returns the System.Type object for the newly created class. If a data class with an identical sequence of properties has already been created, the System.Type object for that class is returned.
member.param: The properties to be added to the new class.
member.returns: The object for the newly created class.
member.remarks: Data classes are created in an in-memory assembly in the current application domain. All data classes inherit from System.Linq.Dynamic.DynamicClass and are given automatically generated names that should be considered private (the names will be unique within the application domain but not across multiple invocations of the application). Note that once created, a data class stays in memory for the lifetime of the current application domain. There is currently no way to unload a dynamically created data class.
